summary: The Reentry Act of 2025 amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to permit states to provide Medicaid medical assistance to inmates during the 30 days preceding their release. It also mandates a report from the Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission on the impact of this change, analyzing healthcare standards in correctional facilities, and assessing the transition of released individuals back into the community. The report will include recommendations to improve access to healthcare and facilitate effective transitions, including a focus on addiction treatment.
